column4: who would I be able to speak to, to get an answer on when vserver will be supported in ubuntu ?
well I need a supported vserver kernel
debian has kernel-vserver in all their releases
now i'm stuck with a dapper box and no supported kernel, there is this edgy kernel, linux-vserver-image-2.6.17-11-vserver-generic, but it has not been patched
so this kernel would be vulnerable to the latest exploits
are you referring to linux-vserver.org or linuxvirtualserver.org ?
they don't seem to provide a public git tree
if you write up a spec to include it in 7.10, I'll try to allocate some resources to review it.
you'll want to look at how we handle diffs to our ubuntu-gutsy git tree  (see http://hera.kernel.org/git/)
so what the issue is right now, is nobody has taken charge of support to linux-vserver (kernel) ?
isn't this quite a across board solution ?
and to ease of installation not to have to compile source kernels the entire time?
I'm not sure why you're asking me that.  You'll want to address those ideas in your spec.
